Detailed Description

Default implementation for the class AbstractItemContainer, which stores the items inside a vector.

Member Enumeration Documentation

anonymous enum

ID 

Reimplemented from AbstractItemContainer.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

ItemContainer::ItemContainer (   ) 
 

If the default constructor is used, the parameters have to be provided by using the method Init.

ItemContainer::ItemContainer (  Dispatcher *  dispatcher,
const WCHAR *  text,
const BitmapRes *  icon = 0,
BOOLEAN  enabled = TRUE
) 
 

Parameters:
dispatcher Dispatcher which is informed about property changes of the item container. Usually the control which embeds the item container (e. g. ItemMenu, ItemTree or ItemGrid) is the dispatcher.
text Text of the item. The GUI-component using the item decides whether the text will be shown.
icon Icon of the item. The GUI-component using the item decides whether the icon will be shown.
enabled Sets the enabled-property. The GUI-component using the item usually indicates the enabled-property by a different look of the text.

Reimplemented in FeatureItemContainer, and ProviderProxyContainer.

BOOLEAN ItemContainer::RemoveAllItems (   )  [virtual]
 

Removes all items from the item container. Note that if the items have been allocated dynamically, the creator of the items is also responsible for deleting the items. For deleting dynamically allocated items the following code should used: 

ItemContainer* item_cont = ...;
INT count = item_cont->GetItemCount();
for (INT i = 0; i < count; i++) {
    Item* item = item_cont->GetItem(0);
    item_cont->RemoveItem(0);
    delete item;
}
For items which are not created dynamically it is safe just to invoke ItemContainer::RemoveAllItems.

See also:
AbstractItemContainer::RemoveAllItems

Implements AbstractItemContainer.

Reimplemented in FeatureItemContainer, and ProviderProxyContainer.

BOOLEAN ItemContainer::RemoveItem (  INT  index  )  [virtual]
 

Removes the item from the item container. Note that if the item has been allocated dynamically, the creator of the item is also responsible for deleting the item. For deleting dynamically allocated items the following code can be used: 

Item* item = item_cont->GetItem(index);
item_cont->RemoveItem(index);
delete item;
See also:
AbstractItemContainer::RemoveItem

Implements AbstractItemContainer.

Reimplemented in FeatureItemContainer, and ProviderProxyContainer.

BOOLEAN ItemContainer::SetProperty (  ResourceParser &  parser,
const GuiObjectFactory::PropertyId  prop_id,
UINT16  object_id
) 
 

Initializes the instance by reading out a resource file generated by ARAGON. This method may not be invoked by the MMI in a direct manner and might be changed in future releases.

Reimplemented from AbstractItemContainer.
